column4: ï»¿amenado: I would guess it's a retail system that came with a recovery partition. Is that right, boGGdy?
no, I have the first partition with the OS and the second is for... stuff. it's not a recovery partition
it means I'll have to save my data from it
When you say it can't see your network, does that mean your Windows shares?
no, the internet
any idea?
What is the output of ifconfig?
maybe you can try in english. :)) how do I get to ifconfig?
Open the terminal and type ifconfig
am I looking for inet addr?
yes and you're also making sure eth0 is there.
I can't see any eth0
is that the IP?
Well then that would be the problem.
Ubuntu does not detect your ethernet card.
when I boot from livecd i have no problems
what solution do i have?
Well, type lspci and see if your card is listed there.
nothing like a network device
I'm trying to think..........
the most strange thing is that it works perfect when I boot from cd
Hardy Heron, right?
what's hardy heron?
then yes hardy heron
